episodes.title: Exposing a Peruvian Catholic cult’s abuse of boys | Freethought Radio: In Studio
episodes.description:
Peruvian investigative journalist Paola Ugaz exposes decades of sexual, physical, and psychological abuse of boys by the powerful Catholic group Sodalitium Christianae Vitae. She describes how the organization operated like a cult, silenced victims, and was protected by wealth, influence, and Vatican approval—until her reporting helped bring it down.

episodes.title: The end of a cult
episodes.description: Peruvian journalist Paola Ugaz tells us how her investigation (with colleague Pedro Salinas) led to the downfall of the Sodalitium, a Catholic cult that was sexually, physically and psychologically abusing young people.

episodes.title: Escape from Scientology
episodes.description: Pamela Nickel Williams, author of the memoir Clearly Lies Are True, tells us what it was like growing up in Scientology, and how she escaped that abusive cult.

episodes.title: Opus Dei: A Catholic Cult with Gareth Gore | Freethought Matters
episodes.description:
FFRF Co-Presidents Annie Laurie Gaylor and Dan Barker speak with Gareth Gore, a financial journalist based out of London who found himself covering a secretive right-wing cult within the Catholic church. Gore reveals how the Opus Dei cult is influencing governments around the world.
